data.title: Adding performance.now() to cocos2d-js.
data.body:
While developing on cocos2d-x, it is useful to bench mark JS with tools like Date.now(). A problem with Date.now() is that it only has millisecond precision, which is not always useful for measuring certain operations. This PR attempts to give cocos2d-js performance.now(), which is an open standard available in modern browsers. You can read the details here https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance/now, and the spec here https://www.w3.org/TR/hr-time/#dom-performance-now.

The quick summary, is that performance.now measures time in milliseconds (up to micro second precision), from the "time origin". I am defining the time origin for us to be the call of ScriptingCore::start(). In order to satisfy the requirement of a monotonic clock, I am using std::chrono::steady_clock.

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
[ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
Toggle between windowed/fullscreen on desktop
data.body:
On desktop it's currently possible to create a window either fullscreen or windowed.

This PR adds the methods to GLViewImpl on desktop to toggle between fullscreen and windowed. It includes a test for these methods.

data.title: "The system cannot find the path specified" error when running cocos from a relative path
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: latest git code, v3 branch
- devices test on: Windows 10
- developing environments: Python 2.7.11

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Run `cocos` using a relative path when creating a new project. For example:
   
   ```
   cd %COCOS_GIT_ROOT%\tests\cpp-tests
   ..\..\tools\cocos2d-console\bin\cocos new -l cpp %HOMEPATH%\Desktop\latest_git_hello_world
   ```

You'll get the error:

```
    [Error 3] The system cannot find the path specified
```

Use x flip in Tiledmap may cause the map not to be displayed
data.body:
Compiler:Visual Studio 2013
Cocos-version:3.13

In Tiledmap, make a new tile with horizontal filp. 
In Cocos, use TMXTiledMap to create the map.
Those layers who use horizontal flip can not to be displayed.

Will only appear in the windows, not appear in the mac.

data.title: fixed #16754: [android] Background music which is playing could not be paused while game enters background.
[android] Background music which is playing could not be paused while game enters background
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13.1
- devices test on: Android devices
- developing environments
  - NDK version: r13b
  - Xcode version: N/A
  - VS version: N/A
  - browser type and version: N/A
- Steps to Reproduce:
  
  (1) Changes the config in AudioPlayerProvider.cpp

``` c++
static AudioFileIndicator __audioFileIndicator[] = {
        {"default", 128000}, // If we could not handle the audio format, return default value, the position should be first.
        {".wav",    1024000},
        {".ogg",    128000},
        {".mp3",    160000}  // Change to smaller value to force test case use UrlAudioPlayer to play audio, e.g. change it to 1600.
};
```

```
(2) CppTests -> 8:Audio - NewAudioEngine ->2:Audio control test
(3) Click `play` button -> press `Home` button to make game enter background
```
- Result: 
  - Background music is still playing
- Expected:
  - Background music could be paused automatically and could be resumed while go back to foreground.
  - If user pause background music before entering background, background music should still be in paused state after go back to foreground.

data.title: Documentation should mention recommended Android API Level
data.body:
It is suggested to game developers to use the API Level same as Cocos targets (currently, 13), because the QA team does a lot of testing on that API Level. If a game developer targets other API Level, it may cause compatibility issues.

Unfortunately this is not mentioned anywhere in the documentation (at least not that I could find).

Originated here https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/16729

data.title: "builing" typo
data.body:
cmake/Modules/CocosBuildHelpers.cmake
set(BUILDING_STRING "It appears you are builing natively for ${SYSTEM_STRING} with ${COMPILER_STRING}")

There's a typo: "builing" should be "building". It's not immediately obvious that the typo comes from Cocos itself so users of Visual Studio may believe the typo comes from Visual Studio's CMake system.

data.title: Removes unused 'return' letter in builtin shaders.
fixed #16737: NodeTest (stress test #2: no leaks) is broken.
data.body:
Fixed the issue #16737
'clone' method must invoke the inner object's clone method rather than its raw pointer.
It's broken after https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/16335 was merged.
